data.name: SelectAction
data.value: Choose an action for the request:

data.name: DeclineOutBound
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel your request to this person?

data.name: MuteUserInstructions
data.value: To mute a person (you won't receive videos from them), you need to provide either their ID or their link.

data.name: UnmuteUserInstructions
data.value: To unmute a person (you will receive videos from them again), you need to provide either their ID or their link.

data.name: MuteTimeInstructions
data.value:
To convert seconds to other time units, use the following ratios:
1 minute = 60 seconds, 1 hour = 3600 seconds, 1 day = 86400 seconds.
Enter the mute time in seconds or a date in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS:

data.name: UserWillBeUnmuted
data.value: The user will be unmuted at {0:yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss} (in {1} seconds).

data.name: UserWillBeUnmutedAt
data.value: The user will be unmuted at {0:yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss}.

data.name: UserWillBeMutedIndefinitely
data.value: The user will be muted indefinitely.

data.name: InvalidMuteTimeFormat
data.value: Please enter the mute time in seconds or a date in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Or type 'Indefinitely'.

data.name: ConfirmFinalDecision
data.value: Review your decision and confirm it if you are sure this is what you need (otherwise, type /start)

data.name: UserInMute
data.value: The user is muted until: {0} Are you sure you want to unmute them? If not, type /start

data.name: NoActiveMute
data.value: The contact is not currently muted.

data.name: HelpText
data.value: Working with video links: Just send me a link. Here's an example of what your message might look like: video_link Some cool text that will be sent along with the video to all your contacts, if you've added them beforehand :D By the way, I recommend using hashtags for video navigation. It will be convenient for both the sender and the receiver :) Adding contacts: 1) You need someone who is willing to connect with you and possibly be subjected to video spam attacks. 2) You give them your (or take their) link in the format: 1234ab56-cde-78fg-01hi-2j34k56790 (You can find the link in the main menu under the "My Link" button). 3) Then click the "Add Contact" button in the main menu. After clicking, you will be asked to provide the link of the person you want to add, in the format: 1234ab56-cde-78fg-01hi-2j34k56790 Just the link, no need to write anything else. If the link is invalid and no one is found, you will be notified and returned to the main menu. Also, if you decide not to bother the person with videos, you can click the "Back" button, and the process will be stopped. You will be returned to the main menu. 4) If someone is found, you will be notified, and all that's left is to click a couple of buttons. 5) Information about the person will be shown, and you will be asked to confirm sending the request to them. This will be your last chance to reconsider and refuse to add the person to your contacts, so be careful. 6) The person will receive a notification about the request, and all you have to do is wait for them to accept it. After that, your videos will be sent to your contacts (including the new person you just added). How to accept a contact request: 1) Click the "View Incoming Contact Requests" button. 2) Find the button with the name of the person you know and want to add to your contacts. 3) Click on that button, and that's it. You will be presented with a decision menu. Enjoy using the bot! The project is still very young, constantly improving and changing, so keep an eye on updates! Either manually or through the person who gave you the link to this wonderful bot :D Links that should be supported can be found here

data.name: GroupHelpText
data.value:
Just send me the command: /link [video_link]
PS: The square brackets are not needed :)

data.name: WhosTheGeniusText
data.value:
Hello everyone! I'm ZenonEl, the creator of this bag of code and algorithms. My GitHub: https://github.com/ZenonEl/
The idea for this bot came to me when, once again, my friends had to manually send me TikTok videos (which I don't use) by downloading them, sending them, and then deleting them from their phones... So, I thought it would be great to simplify all these monotonous actions for them and decided to create this bot. Now, thanks to it, I can run a simple bot on my PC, set up a list of contacts from whom I want to receive videos, and that's itâ€”making life easier for both myself and my friends. Convenient! Enjoy using it!
